result.execSummary:
The defendant Gregory A. Henze was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

miscConds.notes:
--To pay $100 domestic abuse surcharge
--To pay costs of $243
--To pay $200 DNA Surcharge

--Complete Certified Batterer's Treatment - if available - if not, return to Court for alternate plan
--Certified Batterer's Assessment & follow-through with all recommended treatment
--Assessment within 60 days of sentencing
--To undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--Contact with Mary Goodale upon completion of Batterer's Assessment for child care, school events and counseling until otherwise approved of by Agent and Mary Goodale
--No acts/threats of violence to anyone
--No possession of dangerous weapons

Arresting Agency: FAPD

  Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his/her system.  Non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/work-release privileges without further process.

  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

records.addlTxt: With elements and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.
Scheduling notice for jail commencement

Case called at 8:54 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Sarah O'Brien presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Gregory A. Henze in court with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek. DA Susan V. Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Mr. Henze waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Arraignment.
State files information; Arraignment:--service of Information admitted, reading waived

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered on Counts #2 & #3; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #1
off-record: 9:21 - 9:22 am - for discussion about available counseling

On Counts #2 & #3, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 18 months, each count, concurrent, with conditions:
--serve 20 days in Jefferson County Jail, withOUT Huber/Work-release privileges; to commence 9/29/14 by 7:00 pm 
--Complete Certified Batterer's Treatment - if available - if not, return to Court for alternate plan
--Certified Batterer's Assessment & follow-through with all recommended treatment
--Assessment within 60 days of sentencing
--To undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--Contact with Mary Goodale upon completion of Batterer's Assessment for child care, school events and counseling until otherwise approved of by Agent and Mary Goodale
--No acts/threats of violence to anyone
--No possession of dangerous weapons
--To pay $200 domestic abuse surcharge ($100 each count)
--To pay costs of $486 ($243 each count)
--To pay $400 DNA Surcharge ($200 each count)

Days credit for time already served: 2 days
Recess: 9:28 am
Preliminary hearing on August 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling Notice

Defendant Gregory A. Henze in court with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek. DA Susan V. Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

On Defendant's Motion to Modify Bond:
Arguments presented
Court presents basis and denies motion to modify bond
Atty Svehlek requests the matter be set for preliminary hearing
Recess: 10:12 am

Defendants motion to modify bond
Status conference on August 1, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Motion hearing on August 1, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Scheduling Notices; one to Defendant, one to alleged victim by request of Defense Counsel

Case called at 9:41 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Gregory A. Henze in court with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Svehlek: Received discovery & have had PTC & conference with the client. Do have offer to resolve, but are not accepting at this time. Orally motions to modify bond regarding non-monetary conditions. Can file motion today. Requests motion heaing be set next week
Court continues bond
Recess: 9:43 am

Defendant's
Status conference on July 25, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on July 9, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Scheduling Notice
Defendant signed bond on 6/9/14, original bond was returned to the COC by JCSD on 6/10/14

Case called at 1:42 pm
Defendant Gregory A. Henze in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office. Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney Svehlek informs the Court that the defendant qualifies for SPD representation.
The Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; charges and maximum penalties recited
Court finds that the criminal complaint states probable cause to support Count #1- #3.
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $2,500.00 signature bond, with conditions: 
-No contact with Mary Ann Goodale or 14 year old son of Ms. Goodale
-Defendant may return one time to the residence with law enforcement to obtain his personal belongings
-Defendant to provide updated address to the Court within 48 hours

Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.
Attorney Svehlek inquires of the Court the case designation.
Court inquires of the Clerk regarding the case designation.
Court directs the case be renumbered to 14CF190.

Recess: 1:57 pm
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
PTC: 7/9/14 at 11:00 am
Status: 7/25/14 at 9:30 am
